page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area covered by the grid is rural. the land is part of the undulating Cheshire plain nestling into the foothills of the Pennines. There are two villages in the area Rode Heath and Scholar Green.Both villages try to keep up village traditions despite recent residential building. In the past which dates back to pre Norman times the main occupation was agriculture. The opening of the Trent and Mersey canal brouyght other occupations in to the area, especially those concerned with the salt industry at Rode Heath.These however have since disappeared and most of the residents now commute to their work outside the area.
